intro: Kohleria amabilis var. bogotensis, commonly known as the Bogotá kohleria, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family, known for its ornamental value due to its vibrant, showy flowers. The plant typically produces clusters of tubular, bell-shaped flowers in shades of red, orange, and yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Kohleria amabilis var. bogotensis is often cultivated as a houseplant or in greenhouse settings due to its specific care requirements.
